name: Foot Rot
information: Foot rot is a bacterial infection that causes inflammation and decay in the hooves and surrounding tissue. It's common in cattle kept in wet, muddy conditions.
remedies: Foot baths with copper sulfate or zinc sulfate
Cleaning and trimming of affected hooves

causes.main: Bacterial infection (Fusobacterium necrophorum and Bacteroides melaninogenicus)

prevention: Proper drainage in pens and pastures
